questions.question: Is the central arched doorway with a cross above it present in the same position on the church facade?
questions.explanation: In Image B, which depicts a miniature model, there is a central arched doorway on the facade of the structure with a cross above it, suggesting a similar architectural design as a church. In Image A, the church features a prominent central doorway with a cross above it as well. Thus, visually, this element is preserved in both images.

questions.question: Is the round window located directly above the central doorway?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the model has a rectangular window located above the central doorway. However, in Image A, there is a round window directly above the central doorway of the church. This distinction in architectural details leads to the conclusion that the placement of the round window differs between Image B and Image A.

questions.question: Is the bell tower with a dome and spire visible above the church roof?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the structure features a dome and spire on its bell tower, which is consistent with ornamental styles typical of such models. In Image A, the church indeed has a bell tower with a dome and spire visible above the roof, indicating that both share this architectural element.

questions.question: Are white umbrellas positioned over tables to the left of the church?
questions.explanation: Image B, being a model, depicts a miniature setting with tables, chairs, and figures, but lacks umbrellas. In contrast, Image A shows real-life umbrellas over tables located to the left of the church. This indicates that the feature is absent in the model version (Image B).

questions.question: Is a tree located near the café on the left side of the image?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the model adds decorative trees beside the structure but does not indicate an actual café or its specific positioning as seen in Image A, where there is a tree near the café area. Thus, the presence and specific positioning relative to a café are not directly mirrored in the model.

questions.question: Are curved stone steps leading up to the church entrance visible on the right side of the image?
questions.explanation: In the edited image (Image B), the model does not feature curved stone steps leading to the entrance. In Image A, there is a set of curved steps leading up to the church entrance visible on the right side. Therefore, this architectural feature is not replicated on the model.

questions.question: Is a building with blue-and-white tiled walls and black metal balconies visible to the left of the church?
questions.explanation: Image B does not include surrounding buildings in its miniature representation. In Image A, there is a building with distinctive blue-and-white tiled walls and balconies to the left side of the church. This element is absent in Image B, which aims to focus only on the church structure.

questions.question: Is a small cross visible at the very top of the bell tower?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the model includes a decorative element resembling a small cross at the top of its dome. Image A includes similar crosses on small spire elements of the church. Hence, both images include this feature, albeit on different architectural details.

questions.question: Is the roof of the church covered in red tiles?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the model roof does not display red tiles; it is uniformly colored and styled. Conversely, Image A's church has a roof partially visible with red tiles. This difference in roofing detail indicates the answer to be negative for Image B.
